Constructor Detail

OmicronAPI

public OmicronAPI(processing.core.PApplet parent)
Constructor used to setup fullscreen or scaling functions. This must be called in init() to work properly.

Parameters:
parent - the parent object so the class knows how to get back to the Processing Application

OmicronAPI

public OmicronAPI(processing.core.PApplet parent,
                  int dataPort,
                  int msgPort,
                  java.lang.String trackerIP)
Constructor used to create a connection between an Omicron server and a Processing application. This can be called in setup() if fullscreen/scaling functions will not be used.

Parameters:
parent - the parent object so the class knows how to get back to the Processing Application
dataPort - the client port where data should be sent
msgPort - the server port where the message to begin data transfer is set
trackerIP - the IP address of the Omicron server
Method Detail

setEventListener

public void setEventListener(OmicronListener listener)
Sets the OmicronListener callback function used by the Processing application to receive all event data.

Parameters:
listener - OmicronListener class implemented by the Processing application

setTouchListener

public void setTouchListener(OmicronTouchListener listener)
Sets the OmicronTouchListener callback function used by the Processing application to receive touch data.

Parameters:
listener - TouchListener class implemented by the Processing application

setFullscreen

public void setFullscreen(boolean value)
Fullscreen mode will remove the Java frame and set the window location at 0,0. This is useful for systems where Processing's Present mode won't work - such as a tiled wall using multiple graphics cards in xinerama (linux) This must be called in init() not setup() to work properly.

Parameters:
value - Boolean to toggle fullscreen mode

process

public void process()
Process() should be called in draw() in order to process fullscreen and input data.

public void setTouchHoldKey(int keyCode)

public void enableScreenScale(boolean scale)
Enable/disable screen scaling

Parameters:
scale -

getScreenScale

public float getScreenScale()
Gets the screen scale factor based on calculateScreenTransformation()

Returns:
scale factor

getScreenOffsetX

public float getScreenOffsetX()
Gets the screen x offset factor based on calculateScreenTransformation()

Returns:

getScreenOffsetY

public float getScreenOffsetY()
Gets the screen y offset factor based on calculateScreenTransformation()

Returns:
offset factor

pushScreenScale

public void pushScreenScale()
Used to initiate the screen scale. This should be placed in draw() before the elements to be scaled are drawn.

popScreenScale

public void popScreenScale()
Used to end the screen scale. This should be placed in draw() after the elements to be scaled are drawn.

setScaledViewMode

public void setScaledViewMode(boolean value)
Used to toggle screen scale mode which enables standard map-like interaction with the mouse

calculateScreenTransformation

public void calculateScreenTransformation(float newWidth,
                                          float newHeight)
Calculates the scale and offsets to scale the Processing application from a target resolution to the current screen resolution. Must be called after size(). This should be used in a Processing sketch as follows: setup(){ size(screenWidth,screenHeight); omicronAPI.calculateScreenScale( targetWidth, targetHeight ); } draw(){ pushMatrix(); translate( omicronAPI.getScreenOffsetX(), omicronAPI.getScreenOffsetY() ); scale( omicronAPI.getScreenScale() ); // draw stuff... popMatrix(); }

Parameters:
newWidth - target width
newHeight - target height

connectToTracker

public void connectToTracker(int clientPort,
                             int serverPort,
                             java.lang.String trackerIP)
Used to create a connection between an Omicron server and a Processing application. This can be called in setup() if fullscreen/scaling functions will not be used.

Parameters:
clientPort - the client port where data should be sent
serverPort - the server port where the message to begin data transfer is set
trackerIP - the IP address of the Omicron server

connectToLegacyTracker

public void connectToLegacyTracker(int clientPort,
                                   int serverPort,
                                   java.lang.String trackerIP)
Used to create a connection between an Omicron legacy server and a Processing application. This can be called in setup() if fullscreen/scaling functions will not be used.

Parameters:
clientPort - the client port where data should be sent
serverPort - the server port where the message to begin data transfer is set
trackerIP - the IP address of the Omicron server

Returns a copy of the eventList.

Returns:
ArrayList

enableDataLogging

public void enableDataLogging(boolean bool)

dispose

public void dispose()
Close the connections that are made to touch server and the Processing Application. This method is automatically called by Processing when the PApplet shuts down.
You DO NOT need to call this method.

__omicron_Polling__

public void __omicron_Polling__(byte[] data,
                                java.lang.String ip,
                                int port)
In order to perform parsing of the incoming data, this method is needed.
You DO NOT need to implement/use this method.

Parameters:
data - the data that is transmitted
IP - the IP of the data's origin
port - the port the data was sent from
See Also:
OmegaLibClient#processData(byte[] data)
